org.solenopsis.keraiai.soap.port.session

Interface SessionPortFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSessionPortFactory, ProxiedSessionPortFactory, UnproxiedSessionPortFactory

    public interface SessionPortFactory
    Defines the interface to create ports on web services. Proxy ports can also be created that manage auto logins, auto relogins, and call retries. A note about the name params below: stock SFDC web service like the apex, enterprise, metadata, partner and tooling use the API version in their name as the binding URL. As an example: https://cs9.salesforce.com/services/Soap/s/31.0. Custom web services use the name of the Apex class exposed as a web service. This can be found in the wsimport generated Service extended class (from the exported web service) via the getter methods that return the port (annotated with @WebEndpoint and specifically the name attribute).
    Author:
    sfloess

      • createSessionPort

        <P> P createSessionPort(WebServiceTypeEnum webServiceType,
                      Service service)
        Creates a fully functional port that will have a session id placed in the session header.
        Type Parameters:
        P - the type of port to return.
        Parameters:
        webServiceType - denotes the type of web service.
        service - the actual service who can create ports.
        Returns:
        a functioning port.

      • createSessionPort

        <S extends Service,P> P createSessionPort(WebServiceTypeEnum webServiceType,
                                        Class<S> serviceClass,
                                        URL wsdlResource)
        Creates a fully functional port that will have a session id placed in the session header..
        Type Parameters:
        S - the service that can create ports.
        P - the type of port to return.
        Parameters:
        webServiceType - denotes the type of web service.
        serviceClass - the class of the service that can create ports.
        wsdlResource - the URL to the WSDL for the service.
        Returns:
        a functioning port.

      • createSessionPort

        <S extends Service,P> P createSessionPort(WebServiceTypeEnum webServiceType,
                                        Class<S> serviceClass,
                                        String wsdlResource)
        Creates a fully functional port.
        Type Parameters:
        S - the service that can create ports.
        P - the type of port to return.
        Parameters:
        webServiceType - denotes the type of web service.
        serviceClass - the class of the service that can create ports.
        wsdlResource - the string representation of a URL to the WSDL for the service.
        Returns:
        a functioning port.
